author: R Sujatha
text:
The results of the Common Admission Test (CAT) were announced on Friday.

Around two lakh students had registered for the test that was held on November 29 across the country in two sessions.

As many as 19 Indian Institutes of Management use CAT results for admission. Students were sent their overall percentile by text messages. Late in the evening, students and coaching centres were still compiling the individual scores in each section. Students, who cleared the CAT, said they had found the English paper easier than Quantitative Aptitude and Data Interpretation and Logical Reasoning.

Experts said many students seemed to have scored well in English.

For Vijay Makked of Delhi College of Engineering who scored 99.26 percentile, the papers were comparatively easier than last year.

S. Sri Ganesh, founder of Dream Chasers, a coaching centre in Chennai, said his students had performed better this year. “Around 171 students have scored 98.5 percentile and 187 candidates have scored 99.3 percentile,” he said.

He said the top cut-off is higher at 99 percentile.

Students were

sent their

overall percentile by text

messages
title: CAT: many score well in English
